pullRequest.body:
Co-authored-by: Iván Renison <85908989+IvanRenison@users.noreply.github.com>

---

Motivated by [this](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/113488-general/topic/.28u.20.3A.20Fin.202.29.20.20.E2.86.92.20.28Even.20u.20.E2.86.94.20Even.20u.2Eval.29) Zulip question.

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->
- [x] depends on: #8974

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ even_iff`
`+ even_iff_imp`
`+ even_iff_of_even`
`+ even_of_odd`

`+ odd_iff`

`+ odd_iff_of_even`
`+ odd_of_odd`
`+ odd_of_val`
`+ one_lt_of_ne_zero_of_even`
`+ val_add_eq_of_add_lt`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>

</details>
@urkud are you going to continue with this pull request? If not, can I continue with it?
Feel free to take over this PR. Thanks!
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by Ruben-VandeVelde.
bors merge
For some reason the commit has the "Co-authored-by" two times

Build failed:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11713335908/job/32625913664)
bors d=IvanRenison

:v: IvanRenison can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
Please merge `master`, fix the breakage and then merge with `bors d+` when done, thanks!
Apologies for the late review, I forgot to send it earlier
Thanks for the review @Command-Master, I was very surprised that the first two reviewers didn't find anything. I was very lucky that the build failed
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11778783128/job/32805892621)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11778783128/job/32805892894)
maintainer merge
maintainer merge
Can you add `odd_iff` for good measure?
With the current definition, it needs a `Semiring (Fin n)` instance which is not available till `ZMod`.
`Data.ZMod.Defs` is quite a lightweight import, so I think that's fine
It might make sense to bake this into the statement, as `Even k ↔ (Even n → Even k.val)`. I think it would shorten the proof here and below.

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion ```
According to the [naming convention](https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/naming.html) this should be `one_lt_of_ne_zero_of_even`.

According to the [naming convention](https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/naming.html) this should be `add_one_lt_of_even_of_even_of_lt`, but in any case that's quite long - I think `add_one_lt_of_even` is clear enough
This seems to be the same as [Fin.val_add](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs//Init/Data/Fin/Lemmas.html#Fin.val_add)
According to the [naming convention](https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/naming.html) this should be `val_add_eq_of_add_lt` - `sum` is for sums of sets/lists/etc.
What do you need this for? Can't you use `val_cast_of_lt` directly, or `val_cast_of_lt (a := 1)`?

It does not work, I get the error `tactic 'rewrite' failed, did not find instance of the pattern in the target expression
  ↑↑1` because in the target expression I have `↑1`, it's okey that, or there is some way to use it anyway?
I made a suggestion which avoids it, but if you want to keep it I think it should be named `val_one_of_one_lt`

```suggestion
  have : NeZero n := ⟨k.pos.ne'⟩
```

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
  have : NeZero n := ⟨k.pos.ne'⟩
```

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
  rcases k.val.even_or_odd with hk | hk
  · exact even_of_val hk
  · simpa using (Odd.add_odd hk hn).natCast (α := Fin n)
```

```suggestion
  rcases k.val.even_or_odd with hk | hk
  · simpa using (Even.add_odd hk hn).natCast (R := Fin n)
  · exact odd_of_val hk
```
Could you make this docstring slightly more descriptive (describe the variation)?
"A logic variation of the above lemma" it's okey? I added a description mainly because for `'` lemmas is mandatory, but I don't now what to put to not repeat the same
Perhaps you can rename it to `even_iff_imp` and then you don't have to add a docstring
Same here

```suggestion
  rcases hn with ⟨n, rfl⟩
  refine ⟨?_, odd_of_val⟩
  rintro ⟨l, rfl⟩
  rw [val_add, val_mul, val_one', show Fin.val 2 = 2 % _ from rfl]
  simp only [Nat.mod_mul_mod, Nat.add_mod_mod, Nat.mod_add_mod, Nat.odd_iff]
  rw [Nat.mod_mod_of_dvd _ ⟨n, (two_mul n).symm⟩,
    ← Nat.odd_iff, Nat.odd_add_one, Nat.not_odd_iff_even]
  simp
```

```suggestion
otherwise an element is odd iff its `Fin.val` value is odd. -/
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Data/Fin/Parity): add lemmas about parity of `Fin` numbers
